timeline.message: Fix(Audit): Fix unnecessary save for audit-notification relation to address persistence warning

timeline.author: jamesrichard91

replies.bodyText: It appears to get set to false and then never changed
replies.author: jamesrichard91

replies.bodyText: Ah! I see. Setting it in the if condition is interesting...
replies.author: jamesrichard91

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I'm not sure if it's a convention we are comfortable with.
replies.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: I myself don't care for the assignment in the if statement.  In my opinion the if statement should just be checking a boolean condition not also assigning the value to the variable that it ultimately checks.  I would assign it beforehand and then check if the variable is true then find the existing item.
replies.author: psantos1113

replies.bodyText: I agree with Paulo, like James I missed it the first time I was reviewing and missed where it was getting set because I'm not used to seeing those get set as part of a conditional
replies.author: ChomickiM

timeline.message: Refactor(Audit): Move variable assignement to separate line from if-statement
